content:
• Friday, March 8, 2013
  • ELN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ELN +7%. THOR-OLD +3%. GAME +3%. TTI +2%. VELT +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ELN +7%. THOR-OLD +3%. GAME +3%. TTI +2%. VELT +2%.
    After-hours top losers: RMBS -4%. LKQ -4%. EZPW -4%. MBLX -3%. CYS -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • HRB

    H&R Block's (NYSE:HRB) 9.2% spike topped today's S&P 500 leaderboard and notched...

    H&R Block's (NYSE:HRB) 9.2% spike topped today's S&P 500 leaderboard and notched its best day in nearly four years despite posting below-consensus Q4 EPS. Oppenheimer says HRB's data points and upbeat guidance were "sufficiently strong to lead us to expect a strong full tax season result," and BTIG notes the 3.2% dividend “makes it an interesting total-return opportunity."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • MEMP

    Memorial Production Partners (MEMP +2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells...

    Memorial Production Partners (MEMP +2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells Fargo, which estimates MEMP could increase its distribution at a three-year CAGR of 4.5% vs. 2.4% previously, as the market recognizes sustainability of the distribution and the potential for visible increases in 2013 and beyond.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • GMCR

    Don't look now but shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.6%) have shot right past...

    Don't look now but shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.6%) have shot right past $50 and continue to trek higher as many of the dire predictions from the bear camp seem to be falling away - in particular the death-by-Verismo argument. (Google Trends: Keurig/Vue vs. Verismo). Next phase: With Starbucks (SBUX +1.2%) not doing so bad itself, does this mean the market is plenty big enough for both companies to prosper in the coffee machine/consumables space?

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +2.4%) confirms that affiliates of First Manhattan, which disclosed approximately...

    Vivus (VVUS +2.4%) confirms that affiliates of First Manhattan, which disclosed approximately 8.8% ownership of the outstanding shares this morning, has submitted a notice of nomination of six director candidates to stand for election its Board of Directors at the Company's 2013 Annual Stockholders Meeting.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • PGRX

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -20.6%) said last night it won’t be receiving an...

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -20.6%) said last night it won’t be receiving an expected $100M investment from Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO); it had intended to use the cash to finance production at its mine in Arizona. PGRX tucked the news at the end of a press release about a new CEO, saying only that both parties "mutually terminated the previously-announced investment agreement."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +1.1%) is up today after the company reports the first patient implant in...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +1.1%) is up today after the company reports the first patient implant in a new trial evaluating the company's Aplatzer Cardiac Plug, a device for the prevention of stroke. The trial is designed to determine if the device is safe and effective in preventing thrombus from migrating out of the left atrial appendage in patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation who have a high risk for stroke.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical (RMTI +2.3%) gain today after the company signs a two-year contract with...

    Rockwell Medical (RMTI +2.3%) gain today after the company signs a two-year contract with NxStage Medical (NXTM +1.8%) to manufacture dialysate concentrate for the NxStage System One. The device is the only portable hemodialysis system cleared for home use by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +2.4%) spikes in afternoon trading after CNBC reports the company canceled an...

    3D Systems (DDD +2.4%) spikes in afternoon trading after CNBC reports the company canceled an appearance at a BB&T conference next week. However, 3D says the cancellation is simply due to a scheduling conflict.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 8 Comments
  • YELP

    A day after it was reported that a Yahoo exec stated her company is working on two "significant"...

    A day after it was reported that a Yahoo exec stated her company is working on two "significant" acquisitions, Yelp (YELP +5.6%) is posting big gains on above-average volume. It probably doesn't hurt that it's a Friday and nearly a quarter of the float is shorted.Â  Yahoo reportedly made a ~$750M offer for Yelp back in 2009, and has been frequently named as a potential Yahoo target over the last year. OpenTable (OPEN +1.4%), a company Yahoo was reportedly pitched on by bankers last year, is up more modestly.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • THC

    Tenet (THC +3.3%) shares move up today after CRT Capital boosts its rating to Buy and sets a $51...

    Tenet (THC +3.3%) shares move up today after CRT Capital boosts its rating to Buy and sets a $51 target. The firm cites a number of positive catalysts, including it's strong quarterly performance recently, improved free-cash flow and expected benefits from the health-care overhaul, whose positive impact hasn't even been felt yet. CRT says the Street may be significantly underestimating the power of upcoming reform measures, which aren't even set to kick in until 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN +25.6%), that old favorite of momentum traders and Jontahan Lebed, is ripping...

    BroadVision (BVSN +25.6%), that old favorite of momentum traders and Jontahan Lebed, is ripping higher today. Speculation that chairman/CEO Pehong Chen might be interested in taking BroadVision private could be playing a role. Chen owns ~30% of the e-commerce/portal software firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • AMFW

    Jim Cramer thinks Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +2.1%) may be the top pick for investors...

    Jim Cramer thinks Chicago Bridge & Iron (CBI +2.1%) may be the top pick for investors looking to benefit from North American energy infrastructure expansion. Cramer sees shares as "ridiculously cheap," trading at less than 14x earnings despite a 23% long-term growth rate; he also thinks CBI is taking business from rival Foster Wheeler (FWLT +2.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • SSNLF

    Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy S IV will indeed use green OLED host emitter materials, SamMobile...

    Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) Galaxy S IV will indeed use green OLED host emitter materials, SamMobile reports, while adding their use will make the S IV's display 25% more power-efficient. Universal Display (PANL +2%) is higher, though it looks as if the news was partly priced in following Cowen's Feb. 6 report. The S IV, due to be unveiled on Thursday, is also said to feature "floating touch" technology that allows a user's finger to act as a cursor when hovering above a screen. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • ANGO

    Angiodynamics (ANGO -12.6%) drops in the tank today after its preliminary Q3 earnings...

    Angiodynamics (ANGO -12.6%) drops in the tank today after its preliminary Q3 earnings projections trail analysts estimates by at least $0.03. The company projects a 2.4% decline in quarterly revenue from last year to $81M, missing Street consensus by at least $6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • SQBG

    Shares of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +4.3%) get a little pick-me-up after a judge in...

    Shares of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +4.3%) get a little pick-me-up after a judge in the trial between the retailer and J.C. Penney against Macy's (M +1.1%) throws the case into mediation. Does J.C. Penney (JCP +1.6%) have the time to wait out a protracted settlement negotiation? Retail watcher The Talented Blonde notes that the MSO-JCP deal was designed to bring back its once-strong home department. The clock is ticking.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLDX

    Celldex (CLDX +12.6%) moves up today on a host of Street comments, regaining yesterday's losses...

    Celldex (CLDX +12.6%) moves up today on a host of Street comments, regaining yesterday's losses and more after Roth Capital reiterates its Focus Stock ranking, while Cantor Fitzgerald raises its price target to $16 a share and Jefferies ups it to $15. Cantor expects the company to begin receiving revenues from its CDX-o11 and rindopepimut drug candidates in 2016, a year earlier than first anticipated, while Jefferies calls it "a compelling biotech play with 2 PIII and 3 PI/II candidates providing multiple shots on goal."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • FNSR

    Mixed FQ3 results and ho-hum guidance spark a selloff in Finisar (FNSR -5.7%) - hopes of...

    Mixed FQ3 results and ho-hum guidance spark a selloff in Finisar (FNSR -5.7%) - hopes of improving capex had raised expectations. Finisar is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $235M-$250M and EPS of $0.15-$0.19, in-line with a consensus of $241M and $0.17. Raymond James (Neutral) is encouraged management's hopes for 10%+ growth in CY13 and FY14, but is worried Finisar's telecom ops face "price pressure, wage pressure, and vertical integration" headwinds. On the earnings call, chairman Jerry Rawls insisted silicon photonics aren't at threat, while adding Finisar will "maybe" embrace the technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • EGLE

    Shipping stocks (NYSEARCA:SEA) take a speculative run higher as data from China, Japan, and the...

    Shipping stocks (NYSEARCA:SEA) take a speculative run higher as data from China, Japan, and the U.S. provides some optimism over the global economy. The topsy-turvy trading in the sector isn't for the feint of heart, as the glut of oversupply in dry-bulk shipping keeps analysts extending out their call for a recovery which will take hold. Advancers: EGLE +13.3%, PRGN +18.4%, GNK +10.9%, SB +4.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • COO

    Cooper Cos. (COO +3.7%) trades up on a solid FQ1 earnings beat late yesterday, as total sales...

    Cooper Cos. (COO +3.7%) trades up on a solid FQ1 earnings beat late yesterday, as total sales climbed 16.5% year over year. Net profit also rose 37% as the company's contact-lens business continued to expand. The company revised the lower-end of its FY13 guidance, now projecting earnings in the range $5.95 - $6.10 per-share. However, that still trails analysts consensus by around $0.64. Revenue is projected to be in-line with the $1.6B Street view.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • WPRT

    Goldman Sachs does not share the positive investor reaction to Westport Innovations' (WPRT...

    Goldman Sachs does not share the positive investor reaction to Westport Innovations' (WPRT +2.5%) Q4 results, reiterating its Sell rating as profitability is limited by high distribution support requirements and the Cummins JV that accounts for nearly all WPRT's medium-term profits and cash flow is scheduled to end in 2021 with a buy-out option at 1.3x EBIT in 2019.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • AQ-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: AQ-OLD +36%. GMXR +35%. MEET +22%. AMBA +22%. III +22%. ABIO +21%. PRGN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: AQ-OLD +36%. GMXR +35%. MEET +22%. AMBA +22%. III +22%. ABIO +21%. PRGN +20%. BVSN +19%. P +18%. WG +17%.
    Midday top 10 losers: SKUL -22%. OTC:PGRX -19%. SUTR -16%. TECUA -16%. FREE -15%. ANGO -13%. MXWL -13%. AVG -11%. ARCI -10%. OTIV -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • HL

    Hecla Mining (HL +4%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $6.25 target price at Global...

    Hecla Mining (HL +4%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $6.25 target price at Global Hunter, anticipating Aurizon Mines (AZK -0.2%) shareholders will find Hecla's takeover bid superior to that of Alamos Gold (NYSE:AGI). With or without the transaction, the firm sees HL as an attractively priced diversified precious metals producer.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • WX

    WuXi PharmaTech (WX +3%) moves up on a solid Q4 earnings beat late yesterday. Total revenue...

    WuXi PharmaTech (WX +3%) moves up on a solid Q4 earnings beat late yesterday. Total revenue jumped 15.8% Y/Y, while net profit rose 1.4% as the drug-research contractor racked up stronger overall sales. For FY13, the company projects an EPS of $1.49 - $1.53 on revenues of $565M -$575M, versus analyst estimates of $1.46 per share on revenues of $570.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +15%) are surging on no specific news today. Piper...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +15%) are surging on no specific news today. Piper initiated the shares with an Overweight earlier this week - which gave the stock a +9% pop - citing optimism over its two novel cancer drug candidates, bavituximab and Cotara. Further data on overall survival rates for bavituximab are expected to be presented at an upcoming scientific meeting later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • CCIX

    Coleman Cable (CCIX +14%) rallies today after posting a Q4 that easily beat estimates. Gross...

    Coleman Cable (CCIX +14%) rallies today after posting a Q4 that easily beat estimates. Gross profit improvement was fairly broad based with particularly strong performance out of its distribution segment. Sales jumped to $233.6M, up 12.9% Y/Y, due largely to a 6% increase in sales volume and higher average copper prices. For Q1, the company is looking for an EPS of $0.24 - $0.37 versus analysts estimates of $0.32, on sales of $215M - 225M, below Street consensus of $235M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • ERII

    Energy Resources (ERII -6%) is downgraded to Hold from Accumulate at Ardour Capital on valuation...

    Energy Resources (ERII -6%) is downgraded to Hold from Accumulate at Ardour Capital on valuation after encouraging Q4 sales numbers and guidance. The firm remains bullish on ERII's growth potential but says it needs firm evidence before penciling in more aggressive sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • WDAY

    Strong customer and subscription sales growth help Workday (WDAY +3%) turn positive following...

    Strong customer and subscription sales growth help Workday (WDAY +3%) turn positive following its FQ4 report, in spite of lofty multiples. On the earnings call, Workday noted its subscription backlog totaled $434M at quarter's end (+80% Y/Y), and suggested international sales investments are a priority - most of Workday's sales still come from the U.S. Management also talked up the potential of Workday's upcoming Big Data and Recruiting products. William Blair (Outperform) cautions a 63M-share lockup expiration arrives on April 10 (Workday's current float is only 26M).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • PRU

    Insurers put in a strong day as rising interest rates (the 10-year back to 2.05%) should help...

    Insurers put in a strong day as rising interest rates (the 10-year back to 2.05%) should help profits. PRU +2.3%, HIG +4%, LNC]] +3%. MetLife (MET +3.6%) - which failed last year's stress tests - was not included this year as it's offloaded its banking operations (it remains a SIFI). The firm continues to cut costs, planning to move 2.6K workers out of CA, MA, and NJ, and into NC.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • UAA

    Under Armour (UA -2.1%) and Nike (NKE -0.8%) trade relatively weak after Foot Locker's (FL...

    Under Armour (UA -2.1%) and Nike (NKE -0.8%) trade relatively weak after Foot Locker's (FL -7.5%) earnings report doesn't quite meet elevated expectations. Though the company's 2013 guidance also didn't dazzle, retail analyst Rahul Sharma thinks flat inventory at Foot Locker bodes well for the sporting goods sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • VOLC

    Volcano (VOLC +1.9%) moves up after Credit Suisse ups the shares from Neutral to Outperform with...

    Volcano (VOLC +1.9%) moves up after Credit Suisse ups the shares from Neutral to Outperform with a $27 price target. The firm says the overhang from a $300M convert in December has created a buying opportunity, noting that it's a unique growth story among med-tech with exposure to fractional flow reserve that will drive double digit overall sales and EPS growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +4.9%) will likely be a motion sensor supplier for the iPhone 5S, says Wedge...

    InvenSense (INVN +4.9%) will likely be a motion sensor supplier for the iPhone 5S, says Wedge Partners in a report that has led shares to spike higher. Apple has been relying on rival STMicroelectronics (STM +0.5%). earlier this week, InvenSense announced it had won a stay on a U.S. suit filed by STM due to progress made by InvenSense in challenging the patents asserted by STM through the USPTO. 24.5% of InvenSense's float was shorted as of Feb. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.8%) trades higher as activist shareholders kick around the idea of...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +3.8%) trades higher as activist shareholders kick around the idea of splitting up the company. Execs from Smithfield were also under fire during yesterday's earnings conference call on the topic. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • HPTX

    Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +3.2%) trades up after the company prices its follow-on offering of...

    Hyperion Therapeutics (HPTX +3.2%) trades up after the company prices its follow-on offering of 2,875,000 shares of stock at $20.75 per share, just a 0.7% discount to its closing price. Additionally, in response to the high demand, underwriters have been granted a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 431,250 shares to cover over-allotments.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • MM

    The 8% Q/Q drop reported by Pandora for its mobile ad pricing could be hurting Millennial Media...

    The 8% Q/Q drop reported by Pandora for its mobile ad pricing could be hurting Millennial Media (MM -2.6%) and Velti (VELT -2.3%). Yesterday, Millennial rose after CFO Michael Avon talked up his company's value to advertisers at a Barclays conference (transcript). Avon argued Millennial's ad targeting tech - especially important given the general lack of cookies on mobile devices - is a selling point - and pointed to examples such as "McDonald's targeting a McCafÃ© offering to consumers who are only within several blocks of a specific street corner." (Millennial's Q4)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    Revenue at Las Vegas Strip casinos fell 18.7% Y/Y in January after rising 13.5% in December....

    Revenue at Las Vegas Strip casinos fell 18.7% Y/Y in January after rising 13.5% in December. Though the sector sees a lot of monthly volatility, the +30 percentage swing is raising some eyebrows. The timing of the Chinese New Year could be a factor due to the intense high-stakes baccarat play it brings in,  but revenue also slipped in areas outside of Vegas indicating some underlying weakness. Vegas-oriented casinos stocks (LVS, MGM, CZR, WYNN) are underperforming regional players (BYD, ASCA, CNTY) and Macau-focused Melco Crown (MPEL +1.8%) for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • UAL

    Airline stocks rally as crude oil prices trek lower again. It's a move some analysts say can...

    Airline stocks rally as crude oil prices trek lower again. It's a move some analysts say can sustain with higher fares and trimmed capacity offering margin support. Leading the charge for the sector: United Continental (UAL +5%), Delta Air Lines (DAL +2.6%), Hawaiian Holdings (HA +1.9%), Alaska Air (ALK +1.8%), US Airways (LCC +1.2%), JetBlue (JBLU +1.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAV

    Another powerhouse day for shares of Navistar (NAV +9.8%) as Wall Street jumps on board the bull...

    Another powerhouse day for shares of Navistar (NAV +9.8%) as Wall Street jumps on board the bull side with the company again. JPMorgan on NAV: "We are comfortable that the heavy lifting is behind the company and the risk of a liquidity problem has been diminished."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) now -16.1% and making new lows as downgrades pour in thanks to the...

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) now -16.1% and making new lows as downgrades pour in thanks to the guidance provided with its mixed Q4 results. In addition to forecasting a 30% Y/Y Q1 sales drop, the headphone maker expects full-year sales to decline - the consensus is for a 12.2% increase. On the earnings call, founder/interim CEO Rick Alden argued poor packaging and a failure to address trends such as Bluetooth has hurt sales, and that Skullcandy wants to cut back on "low-quality," off-price channel sales (10% of its 2012 total). Q4 gross margin fell 500 bps Y/Y to 44.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 4 Comments
  • AMTG

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) prices its 6.8M share secondary. No price is disclosed,...

    Apollo Residential Mortgage (NYSE:AMTG) prices its 6.8M share secondary. No price is disclosed, but the shares -2.2% to $22.18 should give an idea. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Gold falls back to last summer's lows - now $1,562/oz. - as the strong NFP report takes some of...

    Gold falls back to last summer's lows - now $1,562/oz. - as the strong NFP report takes some of the "QE bid" out of the market. GLD -0.8% premarket. Gold miners (GDX) -1.1% premarket a day after the ETF saw big inflows adding nearly 3% to AUM.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • FL

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) fall 2.9% premarket after its Q4 report disappoints investors....

    Shares of Foot Locker (NYSE:FL) fall 2.9% premarket after its Q4 report disappoints investors. It's not so much what was said - a narrow beat on both lines - but what wasn't said with meaningful guidance from the company lacking.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • P

    Premarket gainers: P +25%. TPX +9%. BVSN +7%. ANN +8%. CLSN +5%. HRB +5%. Losers: SKUL -17%....

    Premarket gainers: P +25%. TPX +9%. BVSN +7%. ANN +8%. CLSN +5%. HRB +5%.
    Losers: SKUL -17%. MXWL -15%. MED -9%. GOL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • DFRG

    Shares of Del Frisco's Restaurant (NASDAQ:DFRG) slip 2.9% in premarket action after the company...

    Shares of Del Frisco's Restaurant (NASDAQ:DFRG) slip 2.9% in premarket action after the company announces it will price a secondary offering of 4.75M shares at $17 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM

  • SPY adds to gains following the better-than-expected NFP print, now +0.5%. The dollar pops, now...

    SPY adds to gains following the better-than-expected NFP print, now +0.5%. The dollar pops, now +1.6% vs. the yen, +0.7% vs. the euro. UUP +0.6%. The long bond tumbles, falling a full point since the report's release. TLT -1.3%, TBT +2.9%. Homebuilders ETF: XHB +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) laid off about 1.5K workers, according to The New York Post, a mark lower...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) laid off about 1.5K workers, according to The New York Post, a mark lower than reports from some other sources. Whatever the carnage total comes in at, what's key is that store-level department managers are among those getting the pink slips. Each round of layoffs has worked progressively up the corporate ladder from the initial batch of cuts of receptionists over a year ago. JCP +0.7% premarket to $14.95 - for a stock which once swapped hands at over $40 a pop.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +1.5% premarket after Q4 earnings miss estimates but revenues...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT) +1.5% premarket after Q4 earnings miss estimates but revenues beat consensus. Issues upside guidance for FY 2013 with revenues of $430M-$460M vs. consensus $422M. Jefferies thinks this is a good entry point for the stock, seeing a number of positive catalysts over the next 12-18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNKD

    MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD) gains 1.8% premarket as SA Pro author Joe...

    MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD)Â gains 1.8%Â premarket as SA Pro author Joe Springer'sÂ bullish pieceÂ exits embargo. The company's Afrezza, currently in Phase III trials, could be the first-line drug therapy for type 2 diabetes - a disease now of pandemic size, he writes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • OBE

    Penn West (PWE) +3.3% premarket, apparently on speculation the energy company could be up for...

    Penn West (PWE) +3.3% premarket, apparently on speculation the energy company could be up for sale. Using the price per flowing barrel of oil paid via Linn Energy's acquisition of similarly oil-weighted Berry Petroleum, SAÂ contributor Devon Shire calculates PWE could be taken out at ~$23.59/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 5 Comments
  • BKU

    BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) prices a 19.6M share secondary at $25.25/share, a hefty discount to the...

    BankUnited (NYSE:BKU) prices a 19.6M share secondary at $25.25/share, a hefty discount to the pre-announcement price as one of its investors (maybe BX, CG, or Wilbur Ross) cashes out. Shares -2.2% premarket to $25.50 after yesterday's 3.4% decline. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM

  • The global bull run continues as an upwards revision of Japan's Q4 GDP data helps boost the...

    The global bull run continues as an upwards revision of Japan's Q4 GDP data helps boost the Nikkei 2.6% to 12,283.62, its highest close since September 2008. Along with better-than-expected Chinese exports and anticipation of a U.S. jobs report later, the news lifts shares across Europe and Asia - although not in China - with the FTSE 100 touching five-year peaks. Hong Kong +1.4%, China -0.2%, India +1.2%. EU Stoxx +0.8%, London +0.5%, Paris +0.8%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Italy +1%, Spain +1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 AM | 1 Comment
